concept.title: Use stored decimalization tables only
concept.shortdesc: The ANSI X9.8 PIN - Use stored decimalization tables only access control point can be enabled by itself.

conbody.p: When this access control point is enabled, the , , , and verbs must supply a decimalization table that matches the active decimalization tables stored in the coprocessors. The decimalization table in the data_array parameter will be compared against the active decimalization tables in the coprocessor, and if the supplied table matches a stored table, the request will be processed. If the supplied table doesnâ€™t match any of the stored tables or there are no stored tables, the request fails.

PIN decimalization tables can be stored in the in the Coprocessor, starting with CEX3C, for use by CCA verbs. Only tables that have been activated can be used. A TKE Workstation is required to manage the tables in the coprocessors.
